snippet: Martin Redrick, accused of fatally punching a man in in Union Square Park, was agitated by white people, relatives and the police said.
abstract: Martin Redrick, accused of fatally punching Jeffrey Babbit in Union Square Park, has a troubled background, abusing drugs and showing potential for violence;  still, it never apparently rose to the level that might have required lengthy imprisonment or hospitalization; he has struggled with mental illness and was frequently agitated by white people; charges have yet to be upgraded.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: Martin Redrick, accused of fatally punching a man in in Union Square Park, was agitated by white people, relatives and the police said.

headline.main: Man Charged in Fatal Park Assault Had Long History of Racial Conflict
headline.print_headline: Man Charged in Fatal Park Assault Had Long History of Racial Conflict
